gravity_system: Eastern White Pine Beams, Douglas Fir Beams, Concrete Footings
structural_beams: 8X16 D.FIR NO.1, 8X8 E.W.P NO.1, 6X8 E.W.P NO.1, 8X12 E.W.P NO.1, 4X6 E.W.P NO.1
key_elements: Timber Frame Structure, Concrete Footings, Simpson CPT8Z Concealed Post Base
overall_building_description: The structural design of the timber frame building at 319 Stone Zack Lane employs a robust combination of Eastern White Pine and Douglas Fir beams, with specific emphasis on the use of 8X16 D.FIR NO.1 beams for primary load-bearing applications. The timber frame structure is supported by concrete footings, which are specified to be provided by others, ensuring a stable foundation system. The use of Simpson CPT8Z concealed post bases is critical for lateral stability, providing a concealed anchoring system that enhances both the aesthetic and structural integrity of the frame. The beam sizing details indicate a variety of Eastern White Pine beams, including 8X8, 6X8, and 8X12 dimensions, each selected for their load-bearing capacities and structural efficiency. The connection details are meticulously specified, featuring tenons and oak dowels as primary fastening methods. A 1.5” wide by 4.5” long tenon with a 1/2” housing is a recurring detail, fastened with 1” diameter oak dowels, ensuring a secure mechanical connection that accommodates both shear and tensile forces. The use of U2 fasteners, with a minimum 4” embedment into beams, provides additional reinforcement at critical connection points, enhancing the overall load path continuity. The structural design accounts for typical outer post loading, with unfactored live, dead, and lateral loads specified as 15 kN, 5 kN, and 5 kN respectively, ensuring compliance with relevant design criteria. The detailed connection callouts, labeled from CONNECTION A through CONNECTION H, provide a comprehensive guide for assembly, ensuring that each joint is executed with precision to maintain the structural integrity of the timber frame. The use of Rothoblaas VGZ 7400 fasteners in certain connections highlights the attention to detail in selecting appropriate hardware for specific structural requirements. The assembly sequence is critical, with emphasis on the order of erection and the use of temporary bracing to maintain stability during construction. The design incorporates environmental considerations, with the selection of timber materials that are both sustainable and aesthetically pleasing, aligning with the architectural intent of the project. The integration of these elements results in a cohesive structural system that not only meets the functional requirements but also enhances the visual appeal of the building. The project specifications are detailed, with precise measurements and material grades ensuring that each component performs as intended within the overall structural framework. The use of engineering jargon and technical terminology throughout the documentation underscores the complexity and precision required in the execution of this timber frame structure.
